intro: Zanthoxylum ferrisiae, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Zanthoxylum ferrisiae is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
